newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Cement shares lead bullish Nigerian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Cement shares lead bullish Nigerian bourse.

text.p: Strong demand for top cement company shares led bullish trade at the Nigerian stock exchange on Thursday.
The all-share index closed at 6068.92 from 6059.89 on Wednesday.
Ashaka Cement gained 23 kobo to 14.10 naira while West African Portland Cement climbed by 15 kobo to 27.05 naira.
Traders said the two were enjoying a good spell due to healthy account books and the perception that they have bright prospects.
"The assumption is that they are far from peaking," one said.
Buying interest remained strong in the food and petroleum marketing sectors.
Flour Mills of Nigeria gained 20 kobo to 10.90 naira on the back of good full year results, while Union Dicon Salt rose 12 kobo to 30.72 naira.
Nigerian Tobacco Company, rising after months on the slide, was quiet as traders awaited its half-year result. It was unchanged at 2.10 naira.
In the petroleum marketing sector National Oil rose 15 kobo to 42.40 naira. Total closed 10 kobo higher at 42.40 naira, while Unipetrol rose by the same margin to 32.70 naira.
Conglomerate Lever Brothers ended eight kobo up at 23.80 naira, but in the same sector John Holt fell five kobo to 11.50 naira.
Tyre manufacturer Dunlop and Nigerian Breweries also lost out, both down five kobo to 12.35 naira and 13.80 naira, respectively.
Wema Bank went ex-dividend and ex-scrip at 5.19 naira from 6.50 naira on Wednesday.
